title: Educational Applications and Challenges of Flipped Learning: Case Studies in Social Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Process integrating knowledge acquisition and participatory learning activities by applying the flipped learning model to social studies curricula. Emphasizes OER utilization and peer collaborative learning in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: The learner can apply the core principles of the flipped learning model (pre-learning, activity-centered instruction) to social studies case studies.
Based on digital literacy, the learner can develop a self-directed learning plan utilizing OER and video materials.
Through feedback implementation, the learner can diagnose gender/age/technology accessibility issues in flipped lesson design.
In long-term courses, the learner can develop a blended assessment tool to measure learning engagement and knowledge transfer.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
